attributes.action: Make the Metropolitan Police re-open the Operation Takahe investigation
attributes.additional_details:
Both SNARL and the families of the animals killed are certain foxes are not responsible for the mutilations and that a person(s) are responsible, this is due to postmortem evidence from vets involved in the case.

It is vital that Met Police re-open this investigation & that sufficient resources are dedicated to finding those responsible.
attributes.background: Since 2015 the Met Police, alongside the RSPCA & SNARL, have been investigating the killings & mutilations of over 500 animals under an investigation name Operation Takahe. On the 20th September 2018 the Met Police closed the investigation, concluding the deaths were caused by RTA & fox predation

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.

This is a decision for the Metropolitan Police. You can find out how to complain about a police decision here:

https://www.met.police.uk/advice/advice-and-information/c/complaints/
